description: A response from the JetStream $JS.API.STREAM.UPDATE API
title: io.nats.jetstream.api.v1.stream_update_response

config.description: The active configuration for the Stream

name.description: A unique name for the Stream, empty for Stream Templates.

description.description: A short description of the purpose of this stream

subjects.description: A list of subjects to consume, supports wildcards. Must be empty when a mirror is configured. May be empty when sources are configured.

subject_transform.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages

retention.description: How messages are retained in the Stream, once this is exceeded old messages are removed.

max_consumers.description: How many Consumers can be defined for a given Stream. -1 for unlimited.
max_consumers.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

max_msgs.description: How many messages may be in a Stream, oldest messages will be removed if the Stream exceeds this size. -1 for unlimited.

max_msgs_per_subject.description: For wildcard streams ensure that for every unique subject this many messages are kept - a per subject retention limit

max_bytes.description: How big the Stream may be, when the combined stream size exceeds this old messages are removed. -1 for unlimited.

max_age.description: Maximum age of any message in the stream, expressed in nanoseconds. 0 for unlimited.
max_age.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

max_msg_size.description: The largest message that will be accepted by the Stream. -1 for unlimited.

storage.description: The storage backend to use for the Stream.

compression.description: Optional compression algorithm used for the Stream.

first_seq.description: A custom sequence to use for the first message in the stream

num_replicas.description: How many replicas to keep for each message.
num_replicas.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

no_ack.description: Disables acknowledging messages that are received by the Stream.

template_owner.description: When the Stream is managed by a Stream Template this identifies the template that manages the Stream.

discard.description: When a Stream reach it's limits either old messages are deleted or new ones are denied

duplicate_window.description: The time window to track duplicate messages for, expressed in nanoseconds. 0 for default
duplicate_window.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

placement.description: Placement directives to consider when placing replicas of this stream, random placement when unset

tags.description: Tags required on servers hosting this stream or leader

preferred.description: A preferred server name to move the leader to

mirror.description: Maintains a 1:1 mirror of another stream with name matching this property.  When a mirror is configured subjects and sources must be empty.

opt_start_time.description: Time stamp to start replicating from
opt_start_time.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

filter_subject.description: Replicate only a subset of messages based on filter

subject_transforms.description: The subject filtering sources and associated destination transforms

items.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages going into the stream

external.description: Configuration referencing a stream source in another account or JetStream domain

api.description: The subject prefix that imports the other account/domain $JS.API.CONSUMER.> subjects

deliver.description: The delivery subject to use for the push consumer

sources.description: List of Stream names to replicate into this Stream

items.description: Defines a source where streams should be replicated from

opt_start_time.description: Time stamp to start replicating from
opt_start_time.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

filter_subject.description: Replicate only a subset of messages based on filter

subject_transforms.description: The subject filtering sources and associated destination transforms

items.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages going into the stream

external.description: Configuration referencing a stream source in another account or JetStream domain

api.description: The subject prefix that imports the other account/domain $JS.API.CONSUMER.> subjects

deliver.description: The delivery subject to use for the push consumer

sealed.description: Sealed streams do not allow messages to be deleted via limits or API, sealed streams can not be unsealed via configuration update. Can only be set on already created streams via the Update API

deny_delete.description: Restricts the ability to delete messages from a stream via the API. Cannot be changed once set to true

deny_purge.description: Restricts the ability to purge messages from a stream via the API. Cannot be change once set to true

allow_rollup_hdrs.description: Allows the use of the Nats-Rollup header to replace all contents of a stream, or subject in a stream, with a single new message

allow_direct.description: Allow higher performance, direct access to get individual messages

allow_msg_counter.description: Configures a stream to be a counter and to reject all other messages

mirror_direct.description: Allow higher performance, direct access for mirrors as well

republish.description: Rules for republishing messages from a stream with subject mapping onto new subjects for partitioning and more

headers_only.description: Only send message headers, no bodies

discard_new_per_subject.description: When discard policy is new and the stream is one with max messages per subject set, this will apply the new behavior to every subject. Essentially turning discard new from maximum number of subjects into maximum number of messages in a subject.

consumer_limits.description: Limits of certain values that consumers can set, defaults for those who don't set these settings

inactive_threshold.description: Maximum value for inactive_threshold for consumers of this stream. Acts as a default when consumers do not set this value.
inactive_threshold.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

max_ack_pending.description: Maximum value for max_ack_pending for consumers of this stream. Acts as a default when consumers do not set this value.
max_ack_pending.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

subject_delete_marker_ttl.description: Enables and sets a duration for adding server markers for delete, purge and max age limits
subject_delete_marker_ttl.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

persist_mode.description: Sets a specific persistence mode for writing to the Stream

state.description: Detail about the current State of the Stream

messages.description: Number of messages stored in the Stream

bytes.description: Combined size of all messages in the Stream

first_seq.description: Sequence number of the first message in the Stream

first_ts.description: The timestamp of the first message in the Stream

last_seq.description: Sequence number of the last message in the Stream

last_ts.description: The timestamp of the last message in the Stream

deleted.description: IDs of messages that were deleted using the Message Delete API or Interest based streams removing messages out of order

subjects.description: Subjects and their message counts when a subjects_filter was set

num_subjects.description: The number of unique subjects held in the stream
num_subjects.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

num_deleted.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

lost.description: Records messages that were damaged and unrecoverable

bytes.description: The number of bytes that were lost

consumer_count.description: Number of Consumers attached to the Stream
consumer_count.$comment: integer with a dynamic bit size depending on the platform the cluster runs on, can be up to 64bit

created.description: Timestamp when the stream was created
created.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

ts.description: The server time the stream info was created
ts.$comment: A point in time in RFC3339 format including timezone, though typically in UTC

leader.description: The server name of the RAFT leader

replicas.description: The members of the RAFT cluster

name.description: The server name of the peer

current.description: Indicates if the server is up to date and synchronised

observer.description: Indicates if the server is running as an observer only

active.description: Nanoseconds since this peer was last seen

offline.description: Indicates the node is considered offline by the group

lag.description: How many uncommitted operations this peer is behind the leader

leader_since.description: The time that it was elected as leader in RFC3339 format, absent when not the leader

raft_group.description: In clustered environments the name of the Raft group managing the asset

system_account.description: Indicates if the traffic_account is the system account. When true, replication traffic goes over the system account.

traffic_account.description: The account where the replication traffic goes over.

mirror.description: Information about an upstream stream source in a mirror

name.description: The name of the Stream being replicated

filter_subject.description: The subject filter to apply to the messages

subject_transforms.description: The subject filtering sources and associated destination transforms

items.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages going into the stream

lag.description: How many messages behind the mirror operation is

active.description: When last the mirror had activity, in nanoseconds. Value will be -1 when there has been no activity.
active.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

external.description: Configuration referencing a stream source in another account or JetStream domain

api.description: The subject prefix that imports the other account/domain $JS.API.CONSUMER.> subjects

deliver.description: The delivery subject to use for the push consumer

code.description: HTTP like error code in the 300 to 500 range

description.description: A human friendly description of the error

err_code.description: The NATS error code unique to each kind of error

sources.description: Streams being sourced into this Stream

items.description: Information about an upstream stream source in a mirror

name.description: The name of the Stream being replicated

filter_subject.description: The subject filter to apply to the messages

subject_transforms.description: The subject filtering sources and associated destination transforms

items.description: Subject transform to apply to matching messages going into the stream

lag.description: How many messages behind the mirror operation is

active.description: When last the mirror had activity, in nanoseconds. Value will be -1 when there has been no activity.
active.$comment: nanoseconds depicting a duration in time, signed 64 bit integer

external.description: Configuration referencing a stream source in another account or JetStream domain

api.description: The subject prefix that imports the other account/domain $JS.API.CONSUMER.> subjects

deliver.description: The delivery subject to use for the push consumer

code.description: HTTP like error code in the 300 to 500 range

description.description: A human friendly description of the error

err_code.description: The NATS error code unique to each kind of error

alternates.description: List of mirrors sorted by priority

items.description: An alternate location to read mirrored data

cluster.description: The name of the cluster holding the stream

code.description: HTTP like error code in the 300 to 500 range

description.description: A human friendly description of the error

err_code.description: The NATS error code unique to each kind of error
